capital_curiosities.Famous for: Valletta is a UNESCO World Heritage site, known for its baroque architecture, fortifications, and St. John's Co-Cathedral.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~0 km (0 miles) as it's an island nation

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Podgorica is known for its modern architecture, Ribnica Bridge, and the Millennium Bridge.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~50 km (31 miles), if you want to go for a swim you will have to drive ~1 hour!

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Skopje is known for its Stone Bridge, Old Bazaar, and the Kale Fortress.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: North Macedonia is landlocked. Nearest sea is Aegean Sea (~200 km).

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Vatican City is the smallest independent state in the world, known for St. Peter's Basilica, the Vatican Museums, and the Sistine Chapel.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: Vatican City is landlocked within Rome, Italy. Nearest sea is Tyrrhenian Sea (~20 km).

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Suva is known for its colonial architecture, Fiji Museum, and Thurston Gardens.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~0 km (0 miles) as it's on the coast

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Port Moresby is known for its National Parliament House, National Museum and Art Gallery, and the Varirata National Park nearby.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~0 km (0 miles) as it's on the coast

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Honiara is known for its World War II historical sites, including the US War Memorial and the Central Market.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~0 km (0 miles) as it's on the coast

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Bishkek is known for its Ala-Too Square, Oak Park, and the State Historical Museum.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: Kyrgyzstan is landlocked. Nearest large lake is Issyk-Kul (~150 km).

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Minsk is known for its wide boulevards, monumental Stalinist architecture, and numerous parks.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: Belarus is landlocked. Nearest sea is Baltic Sea (~500 km).

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Kyiv is known for its golden-domed cathedrals (like Saint Sophia Cathedral), Kyiv Pechersk Lavra, and its rich history.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~450 km (280 miles), if you want to go for a swim you will have to drive ~6 hours!

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Sofia is known for Alexander Nevsky Cathedral, Vitosha Mountain, and its ancient Roman ruins.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~350 km (217 miles), if you want to go for a swim you will have to drive ~4 hours 30 minutes!

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Bucharest is known for the Palace of the Parliament, Arch of Triumph, and its vibrant Old Town.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~230 km (143 miles), if you want to go for a swim you will have to drive ~3 hours!

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Budapest is known for its thermal baths, Parliament Building, Chain Bridge, and its rich history and architecture.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: Hungary is landlocked. Nearest large lake is Lake Balaton (~100 km).

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Prague is known for Charles Bridge, Prague Castle, Old Town Square, and its well-preserved historical center.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: Czech Republic is landlocked. Nearest sea is Baltic Sea (~300 km).

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Bratislava is known for Bratislava Castle, St. Martin's Cathedral, and its charming Old Town.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: Slovakia is landlocked. Nearest sea is Adriatic Sea (~350 km).

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Ljubljana is known for its Triple Bridge, Dragon Bridge, and Ljubljana Castle, all connected by the Ljubljanica River.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~100 km (62 miles), if you want to go for a swim you will have to drive ~1 hour 30 minutes!

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Zagreb is known for its Upper Town (Gornji Grad), St. Mark's Church, and the Museum of Broken Relationships.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~160 km (100 miles), if you want to go for a swim you will have to drive ~2 hours!

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Sarajevo is known for its Baščaršija (Old Bazaar), Latin Bridge, and its rich historical and cultural diversity.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: Bosnia and Herzegovina has a very short coastline. Nearest significant beach is ~100 km (62 miles) in Croatia or Montenegro.

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Tirana is known for its colorful buildings, Skanderbeg Square, and the Et'hem Bey Mosque.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~30 km (19 miles), if you want to go for a swim you will have to drive ~40 minutes!

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Yerevan is known for Republic Square, Cascade Complex, and Matenadaran (ancient manuscript museum).
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: Armenia is landlocked. Nearest large lake is Lake Sevan (~60 km).

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Baku is known for its Flame Towers, Old City (UNESCO site), and the Heydar Aliyev Center.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~0 km (0 miles) as it's on the Caspian Sea coast

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Tbilisi is known for its Narikala Fortress, Sulphur Baths, and its blend of ancient and modern architecture.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~250 km (155 miles), if you want to go for a swim you will have to drive ~4 hours!

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Nicosia is the world's last divided capital, known for its Venetian walls, Ledra Street, and Cyprus Museum.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~50 km (31 miles), if you want to go for a swim you will have to drive ~45 minutes!

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Tallinn is known for its medieval Old Town (UNESCO site), Toompea Castle, and Alexander Nevsky Cathedral.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~0 km (0 miles) as it's on the Baltic Sea coast

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Riga is known for its Art Nouveau architecture, Old Town (UNESCO site), and Riga Central Market.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~0 km (0 miles) as it's on the Daugava River, close to the Baltic Sea

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Vilnius is known for its Baroque Old Town (UNESCO site), Vilnius Cathedral, and Gediminas' Tower.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~300 km (186 miles), if you want to go for a swim you will have to drive ~3 hours 30 minutes! (Baltic Sea)

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Ulaanbaatar is known for Gandan Monastery, Genghis Khan Square, and its blend of nomadic and modern cultures.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: Mongolia is landlocked.

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Vientiane is known for Pha That Luang, Patuxay (Victory Gate), and its tranquil riverside promenade along the Mekong River.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: Laos is landlocked. Nearest sea is Gulf of Thailand (~500 km).

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Reykjavík is known for its vibrant arts scene, Hallgrímskirkja church, and the Blue Lagoon geothermal spa nearby.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~0 km (0 miles) as it's on the coast

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Nuuk is known for its colorful houses, the Greenland National Museum, and its stunning natural surroundings with fjords and icebergs.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~0 km (0 miles) as it's on the coast

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Kathmandu is known for its ancient temples (Durbar Square), Boudhanath Stupa, and Swayambhunath (Monkey Temple), and as a gateway to the Himalayas.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: Nepal is landlocked. Nearest sea is Bay of Bengal (~700 km).

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Naypyidaw is a meticulously planned capital city known for its vast, empty highways and impressive government buildings.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~400 km (250 miles), if you want to go for a swim you will have to drive ~5 hours! (Andaman Sea)

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte is the administrative capital, known for its parliament complex and tranquil lake.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~0 km (0 miles) as it's an island nation

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Dhaka is known for its rickshaws, Lalbagh Fort, and as a hub of cultural and economic activity.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~250 km (155 miles), if you want to go for a swim you will have to drive ~4 hours! (Bay of Bengal)

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Nassau is known for its colorful colonial architecture, Junkanoo festival, and beautiful beaches like Cable Beach.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~0 km (0 miles) as it's on the coast

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Kingston is known for its Bob Marley Museum, Devon House, and vibrant reggae music scene.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~0 km (0 miles) as it's on the coast

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Port of Spain is known for its Queen's Park Savannah, Magnificent Seven mansions, and vibrant Carnival celebrations.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~0 km (0 miles) as it's on the coast

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Bogotá is known for its historic La Candelaria neighborhood, Gold Museum (Museo del Oro), and Monserrate mountain.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The nearest beach is ~800 km (500 miles) in Cartagena or Santa Marta, if you want to go for a swim you will have to fly or drive for a very long time!

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Manama is known for its Bab Al Bahrain, Al-Fatih Mosque, and its modern financial district.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~0 km (0 miles) as it's on the coast

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Bandar Seri Begawan is known for its Omar Ali Saifuddien Mosque, Kampong Ayer (water village), and Istana Nurul Iman (Sultan's palace).
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~0 km (0 miles) as it's on the coast

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Santiago is known for its Plaza de Armas, Cerro San Cristobal, and the bohemian Bellavista neighborhood.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~100 km (62 miles), if you want to go for a swim you will have to drive ~1 hour 30 minutes!

capital_curiosities.Famous for: San José is known for its National Theatre, Gold Museum, and its central location for exploring Costa Rica's natural beauty.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The nearest beach is ~100 km (62 miles) on either coast, if you want to go for a swim you will have to drive ~1 hour 30 minutes!

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Havana is known for its Old Havana (UNESCO site), Malecón promenade, and classic American cars.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~0 km (0 miles) as it's on the coast

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Santo Domingo is known for its Colonial Zone (UNESCO site), the first European settlement of the Americas, and its historic architecture.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~0 km (0 miles) as it's on the coast

capital_curiosities.Famous for: San Salvador is known for its Metropolitan Cathedral, National Palace, and El Boquerón National Park nearby.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~30 km (19 miles), if you want to go for a swim you will have to drive ~40 minutes!

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Guatemala City is known for its National Palace of Culture, Kaminaljuyu archaeological site, and its bustling markets.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The nearest beach is ~100 km (62 miles) on the Pacific coast, if you want to go for a swim you will have to drive ~2 hours!

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Port-au-Prince is known for its Iron Market, National Museum, and its vibrant art scene.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~0 km (0 miles) as it's on the coast

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Tegucigalpa is known for its Metropolitan Cathedral, La Leona Park, and its hilly terrain.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The nearest beach is ~100 km (62 miles) on the Pacific coast, if you want to go for a swim you will have to drive ~2 hours!

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Lima is known for its historic center (a UNESCO World Heritage site), Plaza Mayor, and its vibrant culinary scene with world-renowned ceviche.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~0 km (0 miles) as it's on the Pacific coast

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Caracas is known for its Avila Mountain, Plaza Bolívar, and its blend of colonial and modern architecture.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~15 km (9 miles), if you want to go for a swim you will have to drive ~30 minutes!

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Wellington is known for its vibrant arts scene, Te Papa Museum, and the iconic cable car. It's often called the 'Coolest Little Capital in the World'.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~0 km (0 miles) as it's on the coast

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Dakar is known for its Gorée Island (UNESCO site), African Renaissance Monument, and its vibrant markets.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~0 km (0 miles) as it's on the coast

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Yaoundé is known for its Benedictine Museum of Mont Fébé, Mvog-Betsi Zoo, and its green, hilly landscape.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~200 km (124 miles), if you want to go for a swim you will have to drive ~3 hours!

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Tunis is known for its ancient Medina (UNESCO site), Bardo National Museum, and the ruins of Carthage nearby.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~0 km (0 miles) as it's on the Mediterranean coast

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Riyadh is known for its Kingdom Centre Tower, Al Faisaliah Centre, and its blend of traditional and ultra-modern architecture.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~400 km (250 miles) to the Persian Gulf, if you want to go for a swim you will have to drive ~4 hours!

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Jerusalem is sacred to Jews, Christians, and Muslims, known for the Western Wall, Church of the Holy Sepulchre, and Dome of the Rock.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~60 km (37 miles), if you want to go for a swim you will have to drive ~1 hour!

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Islamabad is known for its Faisal Mosque, Pakistan Monument, and its scenic Margalla Hills National Park.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: The beach is distant ~150 km (93 miles), if you want to go for a swim you will have to drive ~2 hours!

capital_curiosities.Famous for: Nur-Sultan is known for its futuristic architecture, including the Baiterek Tower, Khan Shatyr, and the Palace of Peace and Reconciliation.
capital_curiosities.Distance from the beach: Kazakhstan is landlocked. The nearest large body of water for swimming is Lake Balkhash (~400 km).
